illustration.illusobjdesc: The Titan Astraeus greets Aurora (Eos to the Greeks), as three of their four children hover below: Boreas, the north wind, with clenched fists; Zephyrus, the west wind, emptying rain from a bowl; and Notus, the south wind, bearing flowers. Astraeus stands or hovers near the middle of the design, his feet resting on Zephyrus' buttocks. He faces forward and leans slightly left as he embraces Aurora with his left arm and clasps her hand with his right hand. He is nude except for a cloth that wraps around his pelvis. Aurora stands or hovers left just to the right of Astraeus, facing left. Her left arm is at her side, and her right forearm is extended slightly so that she can hold Astraeus' hand with her right hand. She seems to be supported by the lower body of Notus. She wears a crown or tiara with a bun and a long layered sleeveless gown; the top, decorative layer swirls around her. Zephyrus flies or hovers near the bottom left corner in a nearly prone position. His legs are bent with his right knee down and his left leg extended. He is letting raindrops fall from a bowl, which he carries with the opening facing away from the viewer. He wears mid-calf boots with laces, and a cloak or sleeveless tunic that drapes over his shoulder and covers both legs. Boreas hovers or flies just above Zephyrus. He faces left and away from the viewer; his left shoulder is raised and both arms are extended rigidly straight out in front of him, his hands clenched in fists. His lower body is mostly hidden. He is wearing a cloak that wraps around his upper body and billows behind him. Notus flies or hovers in the lower right corner. His legs are bent and extended behind him, while his lower body twists up and forward so that his shoulders face forward on a diagonal from upper left to lower right. He turns his head slightly left. His bent right arm is at his side, with his hand resting in or holding the flowers that lie collected in his garment. His left arm is at his side, bent upward and wrapped in the same garment. He is wearing a cloak that drapes over his pelvis, wraps around his left arm, and flutters in the air below and behind him. Lines extending in a curving diagonal up from his head to the left suggest a rainbow or wind. Lucifer, the morning star, shines at the top of the plate. He hovers facing forward with arms spread wide, leaning left. He holds a flaming torch up with his right hand, and a star shines above his head. He is nude. Additional scattered stars shine to the left of Lucifer and around Astraeus' head.

component.illusobjdesc: The Titan Astraeus greets Aurora (Eos to the Greeks). He stands or hovers near the middle of the design, his feet resting on the buttocks of Zephyrus, one of his children with Aurora. Both legs may be bent slightly. He faces forward but turns his head slightly to the right, and he leans slightly left. His bent right arm is at his side, his hand out to take Aurora's hand. He embraces her with his left arm, which is raised horizontally and bent to rest along her shoulders. The fingers of his left hand are visible lying on her left shoulder. He is nude except for a cloth that drapes around his pelvis, wrapping around his right leg and falling past his feet. The other end of this cloth appears to the left of his right forearm. Below his feet the cloth may merge with the clothing the three winds wear, itself reminiscent of wind. He has short hair standing on end, and his mouth is slightly open.

Astraeus greets Aurora (Eos to the Greeks) as she stands or hovers left just to the right of center of the design. Facing left, she turns her head slightly forward and holds her left arm down at her side. With her left hand she grasps a cloth with a decorative hem that flutters behind her and wraps around behind her lower body to end to the left of her lower legs. Her right forearm is extended slightly and she holds Astraeus' hand with her right hand. Her left leg is bent and extended behind her, and she seems to be standing or walking on the lower body of Notus, one of her children with Astraeus. She wears a crown or tiara and her hair is drawn through it into a bun at the back of her head. She is wearing a long layered, sleeveless gown that falls to below her feet, wrapping around her bent left leg but revealing her left foot. The top layer of this gown flies away from her body, part fluttering at waist-level to the right of her lower left arm, and part billowing in several loops behind her, the biggest circling up to the right before ending to the left just below her waist. This layer has a decorative hem.

Zephyrus, the west wind, flies or hovers at the bottom left corner of the design. He is in a nearly prone position. His legs are bent, with his right knee bent down and his left leg extended so that his lower left shin is nearly horizontal. From his left knee his body rises diagonally leftward, with his head bent back and turned slightly forward. Astraeus is standing on his buttocks. He is emptying rain from a bowl, the opening of which faces away from the viewer. His bent left arm is extended in front of him, wrapping around the bowl and supporting it, with his fingers over its rim, and part of his right hand is visible holding the rim near the top. His right cheek may be resting against the bottom of the bowl; his left may be touching his left shoulder. His mouth is open. Raindrops pour from the bowl down to the left. He wears mid-calf boots with laces and a cloak or sleeveless tunic that drapes over his shoulder and covers both legs. It may be gathered at the waist. His hair is short.

Boreas, the north wind, hovers or flies with clenched fists just above Zephyrus. He faces left and away from the viewer, so that he is seen partly from behind. His upper body is vertical, but he may be bending backward at the waist. His left shoulder is raised, and both arms are extended rigidly straight out in front of him, his right arm horizontally, and his left arm at just above 45 degrees. Both hands are clenched. His head is tilted slightly back. His lower body is mostly hidden, but one ankle is visible between Astraeus and Aurora. He has short hair and is wearing a cloak that wraps around his upper body and billows behind him. His eyes may be raised.

Notus, the south wind, flies or hovers in the lower right corner with his head closer to the edge of the design and his feet nearer the tableau at the middle. His legs are bent and extended nearly horizontally behind him. His body twists up and forward so that his shoulders face forward on a diagonal from upper left to lower right. He turns his head slightly to the left so that his face is seen in three-quarters profile. His mouth may be slightly open. His bent right arm is at his side, forearm extended and hand holding or resting in the flowers that rest in his garment. His left arm is at his side and bent upward, wrapped in the same garment, which covers both arm and hand. He is wearing a cloak that drapes over his pelvis and upper thighs, wraps around his left arm, and flutters in the air below and behind him. His hair is relatively long and standing on end. Lines extending in a curving diagonal up from his head to the left suggest a rainbow or wind. Aurora may be standing on his pelvis and lower body.

Lucifer, the morning star, shines at the top of the plate. He hovers facing forward with his arms spread wide, leaning to the left. He holds his bent left arm extended horizontally, hand open and palm facing out. His bent right arm is raised at 135 degrees, and he holds a flaming torch up with this hand. Most of his lower body is hidden, but lines to the right of Aurora's forearm may be his left leg. He is nude and has short hair. A star shines above his head.
Scattered stars shine to the left of Lucifer and around Astraeus' head.

illustration.illusobjdesc: Saturn (Cronus to the Greeks), grasping one of his children by the arm, reaches for another held by Rhea. He kneels facing right with right leg bent and his right knee resting on the ground, his right foot on tiptoe. His left knee is bent upward and his left foot is flat on the ground. Bending forward, he stretches his right arm out in front of him nearly horizontally and grasps the lower arm of the child with Rhea. She holds Saturn's right wrist. His left arm is bent and drawn back, and he holds the forearm of the child behind his back with this hand. He is nude and has long hair and a beard. His head is encircled by a band over his hair. The child that Saturn holds behind him dangles facing away and slightly to the right, bending or falling backward. His legs are spread and both are bent. His left arm hangs down, slightly bent, from his shoulder. Saturn holds his right upper arm up horizontally, while his lower arm dangles downward. He is nude and has short hair. Rhea (Ops to the Greeks) sits or kneels facing right and slightly forward at the right side of the design. She leans right, away from Saturn, although she tilts her head back and turns it left. Her mouth is open and her eyes are raised. Her bent left arm embraces a child resting upside down on her lap. With her right hand she grasps Saturn's wrist as he holds the child's forearm. She is wearing a long gown that covers her lower body entirely so that it is difficult to see how she is seated, except that her knees are bent. She has short hair, or long hair escaping at the nape of her neck from her coiffure, and wears a hood or cloak over her head. The child on her lap lies with its head bent back so that its face is visible upside down, looking up. Its right arm is bent upward by Saturn's grasp. It is swathed in cloth that drapes its lower body and falls in folds to the floor to the right of Rhea. Otherwise it is nude. It has short hair and may be male or female. Two spirits hover or fly in the background, their bodies horizontal, or nearly so. Both are positioned with their heads toward the right side of the design. The spirit to the right is visible from the thighs up. Her torso faces forward, but she turns her head to look up. She holds her slightly bent right arm vertically up over her head, and holds a flower with two fingers of her right hand. Her left arm is bent upward and held close to her side, her hand near her shoulder. She is wearing a gown, belted at the waist, with a cloak draped over her right shoulder and fluttering down past her waist. Her hair seems to be drawn back into a bun. The lower body of the spirit at the left faces forward and down, with her legs together, but she twists at the waist so that her upper body faces forward and slightly up. Her right arm is bent upward near her side, her right hand near her shoulder. She holds her left arm out and bent upward, and she is holding a large bunch of grapes with this hand. She is wearing a skirt and shirt, or a gown with a second layer covering her upper body, belted at the waist. A band of vegetation arches gently across the plate from upper left corner to lower right corner. Near the upper left corner it consists of tassled grain surrounding the leftmost spirit. As it progresses rightward, near Saturn's head it changes to flowers in bloom surrounding the rightmost spirit. As it reaches and passes Rhea it becomes branches of leaves, some with berries (see just to the right of Rhea's left arm).

component.illusobjdesc: Saturn (Cronus to the Greeks), grasping one of his children by the arm, reaches for another that Rhea holds. He kneels facing right with right leg bent and his right knee resting on the ground, his right foot on tiptoe. His left knee is bent upward and his left foot is flat on the ground. Bending forward, he stretches his right arm out in front of him nearly horizontally and grasps the lower arm of the child with Rhea. Rhea holds his right wrist. His head is bent back so that he can look forward. His left arm is bent and drawn back, and he holds the forearm of the child behind his back with this hand. He may be resting his chest on his left thigh. He is nude and has long hair and a beard. His head is encircled by a band over his hair.

The child that Saturn holds behind him dangles facing away and slightly to the right, bending or falling backward. His legs are spread and both are bent. His right knee is up and out to the right, while his left knee is down; he may be resting part of his weight on this knee or foot (which is on tiptoe). His left arm hangs down, slightly bent, from his shoulder. He may be holding something with this hand. Saturn holds his right upper arm up horizontally, while his lower arm dangles downward. His head is bent back and turned slightly right so that his face is partially visible from behind. He is nude and has short hair.

Rhea (Ops to the Greeks) sits or kneels facing right and slightly forward at the right side of the design. She leans right, away from Saturn, although she tilts her head back and turns it left. Her mouth is open and her eyes are raised. Her bent left arm embraces a child resting upside down on her lap, wrapped around this child's body with her hand holding its clothes at its back. Her right arm is raised at 135 degrees, with her forearm in towards her body and her hand grasping Saturn's wrist as he holds the child's forearm. She is wearing a long gown that covers her lower body entirely so that it is difficult to see how she is seated, except that her knees are bent. She has short hair, or long hair escaping at the nape of her neck from her coiffure, and wears a hood or cloak over her head. The child on her lap lies with its head bent back so that its face is visible upside down, looking up. Its mouth may be slightly open. Its body is turned away from the viewer, toward Rhea. Its right arm is bent upward by Saturn's grasp. It is swathed in cloth that drapes its lower body and falls in folds to the floor to the right of Rhea. Otherwise it is nude. It has short hair and may be male or female.

Two spirits hover or fly in the background, their bodies horizontal, or nearly so. Both are positioned with their heads toward the right side of the design. The spirit to the right is visible from the thighs up. Her torso faces forward, but she turns her head to look up. She holds her slightly bent right arm vertically up over her head, and holds a flower with two fingers of her right hand. Her left arm is bent upward and held close to her side, her hand near her shoulder. She is wearing a gown, belted at the waist, with a cloak draped over her right shoulder and fluttering down past her waist. Her hair seems to be drawn back into a bun. The lower body of the spirit at the left faces forward and down, with her legs together, but she twists at the waist so that her upper body faces forward and slightly up. She turns her head to look up slightly, so that her face is shown in three-quarters profile. Her body is bent upward to form a gentle curve toward the top of the design. Her right arm is bent upward near her side, her right hand near her shoulder. She holds her left arm out and bent upward, and she is holding a large bunch of grapes with this hand. She is wearing a skirt and shirt, or a gown with a second layer covering her upper body, belted at the waist. Both feet are visible beneath the hem.

A band of vegetation arches gently across the plate from upper left corner to lower right corner. Near the upper left corner it consists of tassled grain surrounding the leftmost spirit. As it progresses rightward, near Saturn's head it changes to flowers in bloom surrounding the rightmost spirit. As it reaches and passes Rhea it becomes branches of leaves, some with berries (see just to the right of Rhea's left arm).

illustration.illusobjdesc: Rhea (Ops to the Greeks) gives her son Jupiter (Zeus to the Greeks) to her mother Gaia ("Earth" in the inscription) to save him from Saturn (Cronus to the Greeks). She kneels facing right, bending forward and passing Zeus rightward to Gaia. She holds both arms, slightly bent, out at 45 degrees. Her right hand grasps Zeus's right arm. She is dressed in a long gown, belted at the waist. Folds of its skirt, and/or of Zeus's cloth draped over her left arm and knee, fall over the edge of the precipice or other support on which she kneels (not pictured). Her hair is drawn back into a bun or ponytail. Zeus, the child, lies supine as he is passed from Rhea to Gaia. His right arm, which Rhea holds, is at his side. He has short hair and is nude except for a cloth draped over his lower body, which then falls onto Gaia's lap. His eyes are closed. Gaia sits facing left at the right side of the design, receiving Zeus from Rhea's hands. Her left arm is at her side, bent to lie along her lap, and she supports Zeus with her left hand. Her bent right leg seems to be crossed over her left. She is dressed in a long sleeveless gown. Her hair is drawn back into a bun, and atop her head sits a hat or crown decorated with acanthus(?) leaves and with a long transparent veil that falls down her back, over her shoulder, and ends in folds of fabric that drape over the edge of her seat (not pictured). The head of a lion with a large mane is shown lying next to Gaia in the lower right corner of the design. It extends both front legs in front of its head, lying on the ground. Gaia's father, Uranus, looks down on the scene from his position between clouds in the sky above. He faces forward, leaning to the right with his left elbow propped on the clouds that surround him and his left hand at his forehead. His body curves to the left, leaning against or lying along the clouds. The top of his right leg is visible bent upward above the clouds. His right arm is out to the left, his hand resting on another cloud. He is nude and has a beard and long hair that flies around his head. Seven stars shine in the night sky.

component.illusobjdesc: Rhea (Ops to the Greeks) gives her son Jupiter to her mother Gaia to save him from Saturn (Cronus to the Greeks). She kneels facing right with legs bent, her right leg down and her right foot on tiptoe, and her left knee drawn upward. The toes of her left foot are visible to the left of her right foot. Bending forward, she passes Zeus rightward to Gaia. She holds both arms, slightly bent, out at 45 degrees. Her right hand grasps Zeus's right arm. She bends her head back slightly. She is dressed in a long gown, belted at the waist. Folds of its skirt, and/or of Zeus's cloth draped over her left arm and knee, fall over the edge of the precipice or other support on which she kneels (not pictured). Her hair is drawn back into a ponytail.

Jupiter (Zeus to the Greeks) lies supine as he is passed from Rhea to Gaia, though the position of their arms mean his body forms a diagonal from upper left to lower right. His right arm, which Rhea holds, is at his side. Gaia supports him beneath his back and buttocks. He has short hair and is nude except for a cloth draped over his lower body, which then falls onto Gaia's lap. The same cloth drapes over Rhea's left arm behind Jupiter. His eyes are closed.

Gaia ("Earth" in the engraved inscription below the design) sits facing left at the right side of the design, receiving Jupiter from Rhea's hands. Her left arm is at her side, bent to lie along her lap, and she supports Zeus with her left hand. The crook of her right arm is visible in much the same position below her breast. Her bent right leg seems to be crossed over her left. She bends her head slightly forward. She is dressed in a long sleeveless gown. Her hair is drawn back into a bun, and atop her head sits a hat or crown decorated with acanthus(?) leaves and with a long transparent veil that falls down her back, over her shoulder, and ends in folds of fabric that drape over the edge of her seat (not pictured).

The head of a lion is shown lying next to Gaia, in the lower right corner of the design. It extends both front legs in front of its head, lying on the ground. The right paw is turned slightly up so that several claws are visible. Its full mane fills much of the corner.

Gaia's father, Uranus, looks down on the scene from his position between clouds in the sky above. He faces forward, leaning to the right with his left arm raised horizontally and bent upward, propped on the clouds that surround him. His left hand is at his forehead, with the first finger pointing and resting along his hairline. His body curves to the left, leaning against or lying along the clouds. The top of his right leg is visible bent upward above the clouds; the rest of his lower body is hidden. He holds his slightly bent right arm out to the left, his hand resting on another cloud. His head is bent down and turned to the left. He is nude and has a beard and long hair that flies around his head.
Clouds surround and partially hide Uranus in the sky. Seven stars are scattered in the night sky across the top of the plate.

illustration.illusobjdesc: Young Zeus releases Saturn's (Cronus's) brothers from captivity. Zeus and one of the brothers embrace one another on the right. Both Zeus and the brother are nude and have short hair. Both cast shadows extending from their feet and legs. The brother, positioned to the right, steps forward and up with his bent left leg, his right leg extended behind him. His lower body faces right, but he twists his torso away from the viewer so that his upper body is seen from behind. His bent left arm is raised to the left and wrapped around Zeus's back. He holds his right arm in front of him, his forearm bent upward and his right hand holding Zeus's left. He leans forward slightly. Zeus, to the left, is taller. He faces right, but turns his head to look forward so that his face is seen in three-quarters profile. He steps up with his bent left leg, his left foot on tiptoe. His right leg is extended behind him, and this foot is also on tiptoe. His right arm is extended down at his side, drawn slightly back, and he grasps the other brother's hands with his right hand. His left hand is visible just above the rightmost brother's shoulder, holding his hand. Zeus helps this brother, positioned nearer the left side of the plate, to ascend the slope the three climb. This brother faces right, although his torso is twisted slightly toward the viewer. He bends backward slightly. His right leg is extended backward, and his left leg is bent and drawn upward. Both feet are on tiptoe; his left toes rest higher up the slope than the right. He holds his bent right arm out in front of him, his hand raised to hold Zeus's. His left forearm is visible in a similar upraised position, and his left hand is wrapped around Zeus's wrist. He is nude except for a cloth that drapes over his left thigh, falling to the ground behind and between his feet. He has a beard and short hair. Both feet cast small shadows. Saturn's head, shoulders, and arms are visible to the left of the leftmost brother, above an outcropping of rock. He faces forward but leans left, tilting his head back to look up to the right. He is nude and has a beard and short hair. The sun is rising or setting over the edge of the horizon, which may be a hill or mountain in the distance. Its beams of light extend upward and rightward to the top and the right side of the design.

component.illusobjdesc: Young Zeus and one of Saturn's brothers embrace one another on the right. The brother, positioned to the right, steps forward and up with his bent left leg, his slightly bent right leg extended behind him and his right foot on tiptoe. His lower body faces right, but he twists his torso away from the viewer so that his upper body is seen from behind. His bent left arm is raised to the left and wrapped around Zeus's back. He holds his right arm in front of him, his forearm bent upward and his right hand holding Zeus's left. He leans forward slightly. Zeus, to the left, is taller. He faces right, but turns his head to look forward so that his face is seen in three-quarters profile. He steps up with his bent left leg, his left foot on tiptoe. His slightly bent right leg is extended behind him, and this foot is also on tiptoe. His right arm is extended down at his side, drawn slightly back, and he grasps the other brother's hands with his right hand. His left hand is visible just above the rightmost brother's shoulder, holding his hand. Both Zeus and the brother are nude and have short hair. Both cast shadows extending from their feet and legs.

Zeus helps the second brother, positioned nearer the left side of the plate, to ascend the slope the three climb. This brother faces right, although his torso is twisted slightly toward the viewer. He bends backward slightly. His right leg is extended backward, and his left leg is bent and drawn upward. Both feet are on tiptoe; his left toes rest higher up the slope than the right. He holds his bent right arm out in front of him, his hand raised to hold Zeus's. His left forearm is visible in a similar upraised position, and his left hand is wrapped around Zeus's wrist. He is nude except for a cloth that drapes over his left thigh, falling to the ground behind and between his feet. He has a beard and short hair. Both feet cast small shadows.

Saturn's (Cronus's) head, shoulders, and arms are visible to the left of the leftmost brother, above an outcropping of rock. He faces forward but leans left, tilting his head back to look up to the right. His bent right arm is extended in front of him, his forearm lying on the ground in front of the rock. His left arm is bent in front of him, and his hand rests on top of the rock. He is nude and has a beard and short hair. He casts a shadow before him.

The three striding figures climb a mountain, hill, or cliff—a feature less represented than implied by the figures' actions and the shadows extending from their feet and legs. The lines right of the lower left leg of the rightmost climber may be a small mound. The horizontal lines below Saturn, lower left, may be another part of the rocky(?) hill, mountain, or cliff.
The sun is rising or setting over the edge of the horizon, which may be a hill or mountain in the distance. Its beams of light extend upward and rightward to the top and the right side of the design.

illustration.illusobjdesc: Zeus and five other Olympian gods attack seven Titans below them. Zeus stands or strides with legs spread near the center of the design, his left leg resting on the back of a Titan below him to the right and his right leg forward. He holds at least three stylized lightning bolts in each hand; a cloth billows around behind him. He has a beard and short hair. Ares, to the left of Zeus, plunges his spear into the chest of a Triton, below. Upside down, his body faces left although he bends backwards so that his shoulders and head face down. He holds the long shaft of his spear with both hands. He wears a crested helmet and a cloth crosses his left thigh and between his legs. Apollo draws a bow and arrow near the right side of the design. His body faces downward but he twists his torso to face forward. His right arm is raised horizontally (relative to his body), with elbow drawn back and right hand holding the drawn bowstring. His left arm is extended straight in front of him, holding the bow and shaft of the arrow. A cloth billows around him, covering his genitals and forming a semi-circle to the right. All three of these gods are nude. Three other gods face left in a shoulder-to-shoulder line near the left side of the design. From left to right they are Hermes, Athena, and Poseidon. Only Hermes's right arm and head, wearing a hat or helmet, are visible. Athena wears a crested helmet and belted gown. Her bent left leg is forward and she holds the long shaft of a weapon over her left shoulder. Poseidon leans forward with one bent leg forward, and he holds a trident. He is nude and has a beard and relatively short hair. The seven Titans lie in various states of distress across the bottom of the design. Two, lying face down near the left side of the design, may be dead or dying. Another near the left side leans back and holds the middle point of Poseidon's trident. One upside down near the center holds the shaft of the spear that Ares plunges into his chest. A fifth hunches over near the right side of the design. The heads of two additional Tritons appear to either side of the Triton grasping Poseidon's spear. All of the Tritons have serpent-like tails that coil between and around their bodies.

component.illusobjdesc: Zeus strides or stands with legs spread near the center of the design, facing left although he turns his head to look forward and left. His straight left leg is extended backward, his left foot resting on the back of a Titan below him to the right. His bent right leg is forward, his right foot hidden. He holds his left arm raised horizonally in front of him, his forearm bent upward and his left hand grasping three stylized lightning bolts. His straight right arm is drawn back behind him and raised at 135 degrees. He holds at least three more lightning bolts in his right hand. He is mostly nude, but a cloth billows in a semi-circle around and behind him, one end flying to the right just below his upraised right arm before it curves down to the left of his body and curls back to the right, with the other end fluttering to the right of his buttocks. He has a beard and short hair.

Ares, nearer the left side of the design, plunges his spear into the belly of a Triton, below. He is shown upside down with his lower body facing left, although he bends backwards so that his shoulders and head face down. His right leg is extended upward, while his left leg is bent and drawn up towards his torso. He holds the long shaft of his spear with both hands. His right arm is bent and down near his side, his forearm forward, while his left arm is raised and bent across his body. He wears a crested helmet over his short hair, but is otherwise nude except for a cloth that crosses his left thigh and between his legs. One end then curves to the right passing behind his torso and extending between Zeus's spread legs, while the other seems to flutter upward behind his legs, perhaps joining with the cloth that flies to the right of Poseidon.

Three Olympian gods face left in a shoulder-to-shoulder line near the left side of the design. From left to right they are Hermes, Athena, and Poseidon. Only Hermes's head and right arm are visible nearest the left side. His head is bent down and his right arm is raised and bent over his shoulder. He has short hair and wears a hat or helmet. Athena's head is also bent down and she wears a crested helmet and a belted gown. Fabric from her gown falls in folds from her belt and extends behind her to the right. The gown parts to allow her bent left leg to come forward. She holds her bent right arm in front of her, bent upward slightly so that her right hand can grasp the shaft of the weapon propped over her left shoulder. Her left forearm is visible above Poseidon's shoulder, raised up behind her head so that her left hand can hold the same shaft, higher up. A cloak or other fabric billows behind her to the right. Poseidon is foremost, leaning forward with one bent leg forward. He holds a trident. His left arm is drawn back behind him and raised horizontally, bent upward with his left hand holding the shaft of the trident near the end. His right arm is raised horizontally in front of him, bent across his body, and this hand holds the trident's shaft near the spearhead. He is nude and has a beard and long hair.

Apollo draws a bow and arrow near the right side of the design. His body faces downward but he twists his torso to face forward. His head is turned to look down. He bends backward slightly. His right leg is extended up behind him, slightly bent. His right arm is raised horizontally (relative to his body), with elbow drawn back and right hand holding the drawn bowstrings and end of the arrow. His left arm is extended straight in front of him, holding the bow and the arrow near its spearhead. He is nude and has short hair. A cloth billows around him, covering his genitals and forming a semi-circle extending from his lower right side around his head to the right and back leftward behind his back.

A Titan lies upside down beneath Ares, who stabs him with a spear in the chest. The Titan's head and shoulders lie on the ground facing up while his torso is bent upward facing forward. His head is turned to look up and forward. Both arms are at his side, bent with forearms across his chest, and he holds the shaft of the spear with both hands. His left hand is lower than the right, nearer to his body. Instead of legs he has two tails: the left tail curls up to the right, and the right tail curls down to the right. The left tail has visible scales. Additional serpentine curls that may belong to his tails appear above. He has short hair. He is nude but a patch of fur(?) covers his genitals, between his tails.

Two Tritons lie facing down near the lower left corner of the design. The head of the leftmost Triton is towards the viewer and down so that his face is hidden. His left arm is forward, bent around his head, while his right arm is mostly hidden. A tail that may be this Triton's appears to the right, lying along the ground and curling upward; another tail that may belong to this Triton splits from this upward curling tail or appears to the right of it. The Triton to the right lies on top of and bent over this tail or tails. His head is towards the viewer and his face is visible from above. His right arm is raised and bent, and his right hand rests on a rock beneath his head. His slightly bent left arm is raised and extended to the right, his left hand resting flat on the ground. A tail with visible scales curling to the right above his back may belong to this Triton. Both Tritons are nude and have short hair; the hair of the Triton to the right in this group of two may be curly. They may be dead or dying.

The torso of a Triton faces forward and right near the left margin of the design, bending backward slightly. His head is bent back and he looks up and to the right. His left arm is raised vertically and bent backward over his shoulder, and his left hand holds the middle spearhead of Poseidon's trident. His mouth is open slightly. He is nude and has a beard and short hair.

The heads of two Tritons appear near the lower left corner, one on each side of the Triton whose upper body appears facing forward and right near the left of the design. The leftmost head, next to the edge of the design, faces forward and up. This head has a beard and seems to have short hair; his mouth is open slightly. The face of the rightmost head is hidden; only curly(?) short hair is visible.

A Triton hunches over in the lower right corner of the design. He faces forward but bends over to the right so that his shoulders face slightly right. His head is turned and bent back; his face looks up and forward. His mouth may be open slightly. His straight left arm is extended down and his left hand rests in a fist on the ground. His right arm is down and bent, his hand slightly off the ground. A tail curls up from the left behind his arms; this tail may belong to him. Another tail with a coil appears in a snake-like shape to the right of his right arm. He is nude and has short hair standing on end.

illustration.illusobjdesc: A group of Giants hurl boulders and tree trunks at the fallen Titans below. The three most visible Giants are probably Gyges, Briareus, and Cottus (see the engraved inscription below the design). Hesiod's text does not permit specific identification of each Giant in Flaxman's design. One Giant kneels in the center of the top half of the design, with left leg bent and drawn up and right leg extended down to the left. Both feet rest on tiptoe on the Titans below. His arms are raised and bent backward, and he holds the trunk of a tree behind him. The root ball of the tree is visible just above his left thigh. Another Giant faces left at the left side of the design, his left leg bent and drawn forward and his left foot resting on the neck of a Titan below. He bends forward and twists hist torso away, lifting both arms up to the right to hold up a tree trunk. More of the trunk and part of the tree's root ball is visible to the left of his torso. Another Giant faces right at the right side of the design, bending forward to throw a boulder at the Titan below him. His left leg is bent and drawn forward, and his left foot rests on a rock or boulder to the right of the rightmost Titan. His right leg is bent and drawn forward slightly; his shin may be resting on the torso of the same Titan. His arms are raised and hold a boulder over his head. All three principal Giants are nude. The upraised arms of other Giants, their bodies hidden behind the three named Giants, are shown holding boulders (and one tree trunk) to throw down at the Titans below. The upper body of a Titan lies face up near the lower right corner of the design; he may be dead or dying. A Titan near the middle bends forward so deeply that his head touches the ground. He faces forward but twists his torso slightly to the right. He turns his head to the right and forward so that his face is visible in partial profile, upside down. His right arm is bent upward and resting on the ground, while his left arm is extended horizontally, his left fingers resting on the ground. Two Titans lie face up at the left side of the design. Only the head of the leftmost Titan is visible, tilted back so that the face is shown upside down. The foot of the leftmost principal Giant rests on his throat. The other Titan lies supine with his torso twisted slightly to the left. His left leg is raised and bent, resting on the leftmost Giant's thigh. This Titan's right knee is raised vertically. He holds the right leg of the central Giant with both hands; the Giant's right foot rests on this Titan's torso.

component.illusobjdesc: A muscular Giant kneels in the center of the top half of the design. He faces forward though his torso is twisted slightly to the right, and his head is turned slightly left. His left leg is bent and drawn up, with his left foot resting on tiptoe on the hip of the Titan below him. His bent right leg is extended down and to the left, his right foot resting on tiptoe on the torso of another Titan, below him and to the left. His right arm is raised vertically and bent backward over his head. His left arm is raised at 135 degrees and bent backward over his head. Both hands hold the trunk of a tree behind him, his right hand slightly higher than his left. The root ball of the tree is visible just above his left thigh. He is nude, though his genitals are not depicted, and he has short hair standing on end. He frowns and has a distinctly wrinkled forehead.

A Giant faces left at the left side of the design. His left leg is bent and drawn forward, his left foot resting on the neck of a Titan below him. His right leg is hidden. He bends forward and twists his torso away, lifting both arms up to the right. His bent right arm is drawn back and raised roughly vertically, and his right hand holds the end of a tree trunk. His left arm is raised and bent, held out in front of his body. His left hand holds the trunk a little further down. More of the trunk and part of the tree's root ball is visible to the left of the Giant's torso. He bends his head to look down. He is nude and has short hair.

A Giant faces right at the right side of the design, bending forward to throw a boulder at the Titan below him. His left leg is bent and drawn forward, and his left foot rests on a rock or boulder to the right of the rightmost Titan. His right leg is bent and drawn forward slightly; his shin may be resting on the torso of the same Titan. His left arm is raised horizontally and bent upward, with his left hand supporting the boulder. His right arm is raised and bent over his head, his right hand resting on the same boulder. His head is bent down. He is nude and has a beard and short hair.

The upraised arms of other Giants, their bodies hidden behind the bodies of the three named Giants, are shown holding boulders to throw down at the Titans below. One set of hands hold a stone just to the left of the tree trunk held by the Giant at the left side of the design. Another set of hands holds a boulder to the left of the head of the leftmost principal Giant; the upraised, bent right arm of this pair of hands is also visible. One hand holding the end of a tree trunk appears above and to the left of the central Giant's head. Another boulder appears above and to the right of the central Giant's head, held by one visible hand and one bent upraised arm and hand. A hand holding a boulder appears upraised to the left of the upraised right arm of the rightmost principal Giant. A final set of outstretched arms hold a boulder to the right of the rightmost principal giant. The outline of a boulder extends downward from the left foot of the leftmost principal giant.

The upper body of a Titan lies face up near the lower right corner of the design, sloping down towards the corner. His slightly bent left arm is down at his side, resting on the ground. His mouth is open, and his eyes seem to be open as well. He has a beard and short hair falling back from his head onto the ground. He may be dead or dying.

A Titan bents forward so deeply that his head touches the ground. He faces forward but twists his torso slightly to the right. He turns his head to the right and forward so that his face is seen in partial profile, upside down. His right arm is bent upward, his hand and forearm resting on the ground. His left arm is extended horizontally, his left forearm down and his left fingers resting on the ground. His left leg is bent and held out to the right. He seems to be nude. He has a beard and short hair, and his mouth is open.

Two Titans lie face up at the left side of the design. Only the head of the leftmost Titan is visible, tilted back so that the face is shown upside down. This Titan's mouth is open and he has short hair. A Giant's foot rests on his throat. The other Titan lies supine and slightly on the diagonal to left, his head out towards the viewer and his body twisted slightly to the left. His face is visible from above. His left leg is raised and bent, his lower leg extending up and to the right and resting on a Giant's thigh. His right knee is raised vertically. His right arm is raised and bent upward, with his right hand holding the right knee of the central Giant. This Titan's left arm is raised and bent across his body, his left hand on the central Giant's shin. This Giant is nude and has short hair.

illustration.illusobjdesc: Pluto (Hades to the Greeks), god of the underworld, and his consort Proserpine sit facing forward on a throne at the center of the design, surrounded by attendants. Pluto's right arm is extended down by his side, resting against the staff, scepter, or rod that is propped against his right shoulder. Proserpine, wearing a gown and wrapped in a cloak, sits to his right, facing forward but turning her head to the left. The upper bodies of three Furies (Erinyes to the Greeks) appear in the upper left corner. Two of them hold snakes with open mouths. Three winged and taloned Harpies appear in the upper right corner, facing right. Death steps or crouches over three human figures huddled in the lower right corner. His right leg is bent and drawn forward, and he leans forward sharply, his torso tilted to the right. His wings are drawn up behind him on either side of his head. The three humans lie or kneel in positions of distress beneath him. Cerberus' three lion heads appear to the left of Pluto's throne, facing left and forward. Each has an open mouth with visible teeth, biting the head, arm, or torso of a nearby human. These three humans huddle or lie in distressed positions near the lower left corner.

component.illusobjdesc: Pluto (Hades to the Greeks), god of the underworld, sits on his throne facing forward near the center of the design. His legs are bent and his feet rest flat on a step beneath his seat. His right arm is extended down by his side, resting against the staff, scepter, or rod that is propped against his right shoulder. His right hand holds this staff. His left hand is visible above his left shoulder, resting against Proserpine's right shoulder. He turns his head slightly to the left. He has a beard and long curly hair. He wears a tunic with a decorative hem; a cloak or other cloth drapes over his lap and his feet, visible beneath the decorative hem, are clad in sandals.

Proserpine sits on the throne to the right of Pluto near the center of the design. She faces forward but turns her head to look left. Her legs are bent and her one visible foot (the right, clad in a sandal) rests on a footstool or step above the one on which Pluto's feet rest. Her hair is drawn back and covered with a scarf or cloak that covers her head and wraps around her neck. She wears a long gown and a cloak with a decorative hem that covers her upper body entirely, draping her torso and falling in folds towards the floor on the right. The shape of this cloak indicates that her right arm is bent and lying across her lap.

Proserpine and Pluto sit side-by-side on a throne with decorative arms. The throne accommodates both figures, and thus resembles a bench or couch. The throne is raised on a plinth; below Proserpine's feet is another plinth, step, or footstool.

The upper bodies of three Furies (Erinyes to the Greeks) appear (possibly hovering) in the upper left corner. The leftmost Fury faces left, wrapped entirely in a cloak. One hand is visible above the cloak, holding a snake with an open mouth. She has long hair, and may be wearing a head band. The middle Fury faces forward, her torso twisted slightly to the left and her head turned slightly to the right. Her right arm is raised horizontally, her forearm bent upward and her hand holding the handle of what might be a hammer an ax (note the shape of the head of this tool to the right of this Fury's head). Her short hair flies around her head as if standing on end. She is wearing a short garment that flutters around her torso. The rightmost Fury faces forward, her torso twisted slightly left and her head turned slightly right. She holds both of her hands in fists up at chest level, each grasping the body of a snake that wraps around her wrists. Both snakes have their mouths open and forked tongues extended. She is wearing a gown or other garment that falls in folds over her torso; the curving lines above and to the right of her left shoulder may be part of her flowing gown. She has short hair standing on end. All three Furies hold their mouths open.

Three Harpies hover or fly near the upper right corner of the design. The body of the rightmost Harpy faces right, but she tilts her head back and turns it to look forward and to the left. Her short hair flies around her head and her feathered wings are raised on each side of her body. One claw with two talons appears below her to the left; it may belong to her or to the Harpy to the left. One of her breasts is visible. The middle Harpy faces left, her head bent back slightly and her short hair blown back. One feathered wing is drawn up behind her to the left. The leftmost Harpy faces left also, with one feathered wing drawn up behind her to the left, and the other drawn up before her to the right. Her visible right arm is feathered and at her side, her right taloned claw down. The other taloned claw is held up in front of her chest. She has short hair. All three Harpies have their mouths open.

Death, surprisingly young and muscular, steps or crouches over three human figures near the lower right corner. His right leg is bent and drawn forward, his right foot resting on the head of one of the humans. He leans forward sharply, his torso tilted slightly to the right. His right arm is bent and drawn back, his hand grasping the chin and throat of another human. His slightly bent left arm is extended down to the right, his left hand resting on the head of the third human. His head is turned to the right and bent back, so that he looks down and to the right. His short hair is blown back. His large wings are drawn up behind him on either side of his head. He is nude, and he and the humans below him cast shadows that extend to the right.

Three humans huddle in the lower right corner beneath Death. The rightmost human is on his knees, left leg drawn up beneath his body and left foot on tiptoe. He bends forward and rests his head on the floor, his face hidden. His right arm is raised horizontally with the elbow out toward the viewer and right hand resting in a fist on the floor. His left hand, also in a fist, is visible on the floor to the left of his right hand. He is nude with visible genitals (minimally depicted) and has short hair. The head and bare arms of a second human appear to the left of the one on his knees. The head, with short hair, is towards the viewer, face down and hidden. His bent left arm is wrapped around his head, supporting it. His right arm is bent and raised horizontally, with his right hand in a fist resting on the floor. The head and arms of the third human appear to the left of Death's leg. The head is bent back so that the face looks forward and up. Short hair that seems to be drawn back (into a bun?) suggests that this is a female. Lines at her throat and shoulder suggest that she is wearing a sleeveless shirt or gown. Her bent right arm is down and drawn back, and her right hand holds Death's ankle. Death grasps her chin and throat. The grouping casts shadows that extend to the right.

Cerberus' three lion heads appear to the left of Plato's throne, facing left and forward. The leftmost head is the highest, facing left. Its mouth is open with one visible tooth and it grasps the head of a human to the left. The middle head also faces left with mouth open and tooth showing, biting the arm and elbow of another human. The third head faces forward, mouth open to bite the torso of a third human. Teeth appear in this head's mouth as well. All three heads have thick manes.

The three heads of Cerberus grasp three humans huddled in the lower left corner. The rightmost human lies face up, head to the right and out toward the viewer. His head is tilted back so that his face is visible upside down, mouth open and short hair falling backward onto the ground. His nude torso turns slightly to the right, with left arm raised, drawn across his body, and bent upward. His left hand is hidden in the mane of Cerberus' rightmost head. His lower body is mostly hidden. The middle human is on his knees, facing left and leaning slightly forward and away from the viewer. His right leg is bent and drawn forward, right foot resting on tiptoe. His left leg is bent and extended slightly backward. His right hand appears to the left of his torso, while his left arm is drawn back behind him, his elbow held in the mouth of Cerberus' middle head. His left forearm and fist dangle. Mouth open, he turns his head up to the right as if looking at Cerberus. He is nude with visible, but minimally depicted, genitals. The third human faces away and seems to be kneeling. The bottom of his left foot is visible below his buttocks and to the left of the middle human's right knee. His head, turned slightly to the left and mouth open, is grasped in the mouth of Cerberus' leftmost head. His right hand and lower arm are visible beneath Cerberus' leftmost head, hand resting on the hip of the rightmost human. He is nude and has medium-length to long hair.

A large club, probably made of wood, is propped on his left shoulder and resting on his knee. His bent right arm is extended in front of him and resting on the club. His left arm is likewise extended, his left hand resting on top of and hiding his right. He is nude and bearded with short hair. One knee is raised, and a large club, probably made of wood, rests against it and leans against his right shoulder. His right arm is at his side, bent upward with right hand holding the club. His left forearm is bent upward across his body, left hand resting on the club just above the right. He is nude and bearded with short hair. Only part of the head of the third god is visible, appearing between the heads of the other two, looking upward to the left. He has short hair and may also have a beard.
